hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Amir ibn Shahr: I heard from the Prophet ﷺ a statement, and I heard from the Negus (Najashi) a statement. I heard the Messenger of Allah ﷺ saying: 'Look at Quraysh and listen to their speech, but leave their actions.' And I was with the Negus when his son from the scribes came to him and read a verse from the Gospel. I understood it and laughed. He said: What are you laughing at? Are you laughing at the Book of Allah, the Mighty and Majestic? By Allah, indeed it is in the Book of Allah, the Exalted, which was revealed to Jesus ﷺ: 'Curse shall be upon the earth when its rulers are boys.'

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abdullah: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Whoever takes an oath falsely will meet Allah while He is angry.' Al-Ash'ath ibn Qays said: This verse was revealed about me. There was a dispute between me and a man regarding land. I brought it to the Prophet ﷺ but had no witness. He said: Take an oath. I said: O Messenger of Allah, then he will swear. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Whoever takes a false oath to seize Muslim property while being perjured will meet Allah while He is angry with him.' Then was revealed: 'Indeed, those who trade the covenant of Allah and their oaths for a small price...' (3:77)

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Adi ibn Adi al-Kindi from his grandfather: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Indeed, Allah the Mighty and Majestic does not punish the common people for the actions of the elite until they see the evil among themselves and are able to prevent it. If they do that, then Allah the Mighty and Majestic punishes both the common people and the elite.'
